name: Rolf Werner
text: Tony was great, went over all of the options and really made me feel comfortable with this company. Then I got to Meet Mrs.kaiser, she is wonderful, very down to earth and helpful.

name: Sara McInnis
text: We have been using Kaiser Pools for several years now. We have never been disappointed in their service. Adam cleans our pool and does a great job. We think he is wonderful!  In addition, we’ve had to have some work done on our pool equipment. They were quick to respond and knew exactly what needed to be done. Their prices are very reasonable. We highly recommend them for pool services.

name: Phil Morgan
text: Left several messages in the past few weeks to get an estimate on a new pool. I stoll haven't heard anything back so im assuming they are no longer in business.

resp.text: Mr. Morgan, our office receives several calls a day and it is impossible to get to each call. With that being said, Kaiser Pools is very much in business and has been for the past 41 years. Please give us a call Mon-Fri betweeen 8am and 4pm and we would be happy to speak with you.

name: T Thomas
text: I moved 6/18 and have a large pool and Adam @Kaiser takes care of everything.  I call him the miracle worker; he is very knowledgeable, very courteous, kind and makes my pool look AMAZING!  There have been times I have called and needed something and he would walk me through and explain perfectly.  He cares about what matters to me.  Outstanding service!

name: Pam Hite
text: Kaiser has done several jobs for us the most recent was this summer. They re-routed the water lines for our pool because the original contractor buried the lines too close to the surface and several cracked. They worked with us to ensure they did it disturbs all the new concrete we had just had poured. Very polite and professional.

name: Sonya Rachal
text: I highly recommend Kaiser Pools for your pool maintenance. I asked them to solve a problem my previous provider could not after repeated attempts. One visit by Kaiser resolved the issue and therefore earned my business. Our home is a part time home and I never had to worry if our pool and spa was carried for. I want to send a special thanks to Chris who was assigned our account. He always went above and beyond the call of duty.

name: Donna Miller
text:
Kaiser Pools is a wonderfully company. Very loving Christian family. Our family wouldn’t use anyone else. Thank you, Kaiser family and staff for being so kind to us.
P.S. our pool is beyond beautiful and beyond anything we could’ve  imagined.

name: Peggy Poteet
text: We really appreciate the job that Adam, our pool service man has done for us.  He really seems to want our pool to be the best it can be and works hard to achieve this for us!  Thanks Adam! And thanks to Kaiser for sending him our way.  The Poteet's

name: Brian Perry
text:
If I could leave a negative star amount I would (-5) Kaiser put in our pool 4 years ago, they hit us with an extra for concrete like another rating here mentioned. We had issues with concrete, coping and various other items that it was like pulling teeth to get them to make good on. They never did to our satisfaction. They started the job while we were out of town ahead of schedule and cut every corner they could while we weren't there. They put all plumbing on one side (all water outlets) and all electrical on the other side (pool lights). This has caused poor circulation and lights that don't reach across the pool. We had to replace all 4 lights and both pump motors in that 4 years. Just this week we had to replace the liner due to holes that have developed (last year I was able to patch a hole but it was formed we believe because they didn't remove all the roots from a pecan tree they cut out).

Kaiser does liners as well and for the sake of saving face I called them to ask for a quote. No return call. I would not recommend my enemies to use Kaiser for their pool installation. Do your research if you are making an investment and get someone who cares about their workmanship (from our experience Kaiser clearly does not).

name: Pam Oberst
text:
Late with this review. Initially they did a fine job cleaning my pool. Chris was assigned to my pool, and was wonderful! They evidently changed their staff, and I had different people showing up (or not showing up) to clean my pool. After being billed for services that were not rendered, I called and was given a complete run around. After making multiple requests to speak with the owner, I was called and told the owner would not be calling me. This isn’t a good way to do business, Mr. & Mrs. Kaiser.
Consumer beware.

name: Ladora Robison
text: BEWARE OF BAD REVIEWS:  We had our pool installed last year. They said the timeline would be 2 week start and 2 weeks to complete. They were to install pool and build a sunroom. It took them 4 months to complete the pool and concrete around pool which cracked before it even dried. The sunroom never was done and after 6 months we finally requested our money back on it and had to hire someone else to complete the room. It took all of 2 weeks to get our money back. Now less than a year later our salt generator went out which caused algae to form. There is a 3 year warranty on the generator so we called to have them come out to replace it and was informed that since we put a bad review out on them they will not honor their warranty.  We had to hire someone from Pensacola to replace it. Just a FYI if we incur any expense we will sue them for any expense that we have incurred.

name: John Carbone
text: EXCELLENT JOB. Throughout the process of installing my pool the Kaiser Pool Staff was helpful and friendly. They answered any questions that came up, and paid close attention to every detail about my pool. If you are planning to have a pool contact Kaiser Pools  you will not be disappointed.

name: Cheryl Despart
text:
I’d give zero stars if that were an option, but here we are. After a local friend recommended Kaiser, I gave them a call to schedule biweekly cleanings. The woman at the desk was incredibly rude and condescending, and at this point I almost cancelled the cleaning but really needed my pool cleaned. The guys were supposed to arrive two days later to clean. I asked for a time window they might be arriving. “I can’t tell you a time.”  Well alrighty then. I’ll just sit here all day and wait. Which I did. Only to have them
Blow us off and not show up. Thank goodness I found another company in Fairhope to come and help because Kaiser can keep their horrible service. Good luck with that Kaiser ;-) keep racking up those 1 star reviews - way to treat the locals!

name: Cindy Shariat
text: We have dealt with Kaiser for 30 years and it was the best decision we ever made in pool service. From the friendliness of the owners and staff to the working of prices and service, they have been the best for us.  They have put in liners for us over the year that have done great. Normal wear, roots under the pool itself and bad weather are the only reasons for changing those liners. They just redid our whole pool a like over a year ago with complete new walls, concrete work lights etc. Awesome job. All questions answered and details covered. Concrete work and all fair going rates. Yes I recommend highly.

name: Bethany Ford
text:
Feb 2020 Update:
Not only does all that is stated below remain to be true, but Kaiser Pools went so far as to put a lien on our property for the fraudulent charges billed to our account. Despite the fact that office manager agreed to remove the charges and send a corrected invoice. We never got the invoice and then months later received notice of a lien. These people are shameless. We finally decided to just pay the bill that we didn’t owe (pool cleanings that never occurred and chemicals that we had on site) to be forever finished with this shady business. The check was sent in November and the lien still has not been removed. When we called today, office manager claims that the paperwork is in the mail. Of course it is. Ron Kaiser is aware and unwilling to do anything to make this situation right. Do yourself a favor, keep moving past this one.

We have been pool service customers with Kaiser for 5 years. Recently, management has stepped out and turned the keys to the castle over to a rude and condescending office manager who bills incorrectly and can’t admit to a mistake EVER. Kaiser now bills for services not rendered, charges for chemicals that were provided by the customer and then when the customer questions these practices, office manager claims that no one else at Kaiser will speak to you. To make matters worse, their pool tech has now ruined our liner by dumping undissolved shock all over the pool causing major discoloration. I have been waiting for a phone call from someone other than office manager (who happened to have provided one of the 5 star reviews with no comments...SM) all week. Who knows if management is even aware but shame on them for going to sleep at the wheel.

name: Paul Aigner
text: Kaiser Pools installed my pool two years ago.  I was having some problems with my equipment and can't even get them to return my phone calls.  My pool is green and they don't care.  Had to call someone else to fix the problem.  They told me "when you buy from them you are part of the Kaiser family"  I would hate to be related to them.

resp.text: Paul, I am extremely sorry this happened. This is not the way we conduct business. If there is anyway we can make things right, please reach out to us at 251-945-7665.

name: Ginny Mitchell
text: We love our pool.  For those who are reading the reviews, please remember, Mother Nature is not on our time schedule.

resp.text: Thank you, Ginny!

name: dawmlw
text: Kaiser Pools built our pool in 2006.  We did not start pool service until this year.  Please do not think that you know more about the chemicals in your pool than a professional does.  There is more to a pool than pH and chlorine.  Our service guys are knowledgeable and professional.  The office staff gets a "ditto" on that too.  After over 23 inches of rain in my pool, I must admit that I am astonished at the clarity and sparkle of my pool water.  I will not ever again fight the battle of keeping my pool chemicals in check - that is what I will happily pay Kaiser Pools to do, which I might add, is more than reasonable.  Additionally, the products that you can purchase from them, (i.e. chlorine tablets, etc), may be more expensive but at definitely a superior product to those I have purchased these past 8 years.  We made a good decision having Kaiser build our pool and now another good decision in having them service our pool.

name: Eddie Robison
text: Worst experience of my life. We made the mistake of paying them most of the money and they never returned a call. Would not recommend them to build a doghouse

name: Paige Pearson
text: From the very beginning, unorganized, and incompetent. I actually paid half and financed the remainder. I had loan company withhold funds until Kaiser did what was promised. Fast forward 17 months.......don’t have the decency to even return a phone call for cleaning pool bi-monthly.

name: Anthony Welborn
text: Very knowledgeable friendly people

name: Audrey Dyal
text: Disabled veteran to get a therapy pool, but the credit fell through. Tried talking to owners, but no response. They kept $4,000 deposit.

name: dogdocdvm
text: Good Business

resp.text: Thank you! We hope you're enjoying your new pool liner.

name: Don Broad
text: Great service

resp.text: Thank you, Mr. Broad! We are happy you’re apart of the Kaiser family.

name: Richard DeMaine
text: Adam is the best !!!!!

name: Michael Freiman
text: Had Herring pour a concrete deck. Within 1 month of completion, every section of the deck was cracking. They did not respond to the problem. Did not stand behind their work

name: Travis Whitehead
text: Signed a contract with Herring pools in late April/early March.  Was told we would be swimming by July first but never got a concrete start date.  Finally this morning just 3 days before I was last told construction would begin, I get a text message that Chase Herring is cancelling my contract because he doesn't feel they can complete the pool on time...buyer beware as I have now heard several horror stories much worse than mine.

name: Wesley Marner
text: Wonderful

name: Matt Richardson
text: These guys know what they are doing when it comes to pools

name: Daniel Humphrey
text: Nice people.

name: Deana Mann
text: Rob Keese was recommended to us by a friend who services pools. It has been a nightmare from day one, still dealing with the messy job! Would not recommend to anyone!

name: tyms13
text: I go here to pick up pool supplies for work. We have a salt water and a chlorine pools. They are so helpful and friendly. They explain how everything works for the pool and give me a detail reading on the chemical levels

name: Allie Ezell
text: This address is no longer a pool place. It’s Enterprise Granite now. They do Granite, Marble, and Quartz countertops and they are a great group of people!

name: J Cole
text: This team is always helpful. Go here if you want friendly and genuine customer service!

name: Chance Petty
text: Great people, products and services

name: Heather Smith
text:
New pool owner here !!
Without Baileys Pool I would be completely lost! Thank y’all so much for all of the help.

name: Michael Beekman
text: Never got back with me.....gonna spend my money elsewhere.....

name: Andy Mitchell
text:
These guys will give you a ton of free information to possibly save you a service call.  They know their stuff and share it freely.

If it goes beyond your comfort level and you need a service call?  They are quick and really good at their job.  Always my first choice when I have pool problems.

name: Cesar Yabor
text: Mike Miller, top notch tech!

name: Corey Clayton
text: The sub-contractors at Bailey's are hands down the best around. They are professional, knowledgeable, and versatile.

name: High Priestess Angelique
text: EXTREMELY wonderful gentleman gave me advice on 7/20/17 1:45 pm to help me save money on my pool system instead of needlessly spending money on a technician which I was ready to do out of sheer frustration. I am just elated over how nice he was & even though I've not yet fixed my own issue I just had to share my experience and do them just diligence by allowing ppl to see for themselves & not just choose a competitive pool company for obvious reasons. Have a blessed day & thank you so very much.

name: Sharon Bronson
text: Always do a great job. Highly recommend!

name: Pamela Kupersmith
text: Awesome, smart, and qualified people that help you maintain your pool even when you have no idea what you're doing!

name: Donald Ellis
text: Called for help and they we very helpful.

name: Alexandra Murray
text: David S**** the owner inspected a drainage easement on our property and was able to advise us as homeowners the steps to correct drainage and erosion control issues. He provided several ideas and advised us to contact the county and builder to have these issued corrected. He has all the technology to take aerial footage and soil samples to obtain accurate information and is incredibly knowledgeable! He went above and beyond for us and I know he truly had our families best interest. I would recommend DSLD to anyone without a doubt.

name: Laura Witcher
text: I called several companies about an immediate project and possible other projects. When David Sharp showed up at our door we had a pleasant surprise. Not only is he a great person, but he was my husband’s youth director years ago and they got to have a little reunion. DSLD filled in and tiled a front porch that was formerly a long planter box. We had previously spoken to many others about the project and never was happy with the response, the quotes, or how the others listened to what we wanted. We are so pleased with DSLD’s work, how quickly they completed the project, how well they communicated with us, and the quoted amount for the work that they have us as customers from now on! Plus all the staff are very friendly and helpful!

resp.text: It was so good to meet you Laura and catch up with James!  Thank you for your kind words and we look forward to working with you in the future.

name: Chase Carter
text:
This review is kind of overdue,  but getting the pool ready for this season reminded me I’ve yet to write one.  DSLD installed a Desjoyaux pool at our house last spring.  From design work (Stephen) to the crew that installed our pool (PM Austin) we were very pleased and our backyard was completely transformed.  Their vision for our backyard and the product they delivered completely surpassed (in a good way) the one we thought possible.  Our project consisted of not just the pool install, but rerouting/hiding a drainage ditch that went through the middle of our yard, regrading the entire backyard, sprinkler install and pouring a parking pad.  DSLD was capable of handling the entire project without having to contract out things here or there so it was nice only having to deal with one company from start to finish.

And probably most importantly David and his team are good people.  5 stars and highly recommended.

name: Robert Anaforian
text:
DSLD has earned our highest recommendation. Throughout our project David and the entire team demonstrated integrity, creativity, top notch customer service, professionalism, and premier craftsmanship.
You will not be disappointed!

name: Rob Sharp
text:
DSLD traveled to mine and David’s mom’s house. The backyard was approx 110 ft and open to all, no privacy. I watched the crew scalp the old lawn and graded down to a more level surface. Then they planted about 20 trees which served as a privacy fence. Mixed in a variety of bushes and plants. I could only imagine how it would look when all planting matured. They laid new sod and it looked like a picture from Home and Garden magazine.

Through the years I have visited my brother and his family and he’d take me on job sites with him. I was amazed to see the complexity of installs he was undertaking. The attention to detail David gives to each install is second to none. I could write a few pages just on that subject. (But I won’t) His new store AquaScapes was an overnight success. I tribute this to David’s insight of products as well as knowledge of the industry. Offering fountains, fish ponds, fish of course and swimming pools from the store, has only broadened the DSLD complete landscape portfolio.

I have to tip my hat to my brother and his team of professionals. His sons Zachary, Miles and Cole play a major part in this well oiled machine as they each have a part in most every install. They are dependable, punctual and treat each job as if it were being installed on their property.

Rather you have DSLD perform their expertise on your yard or not, you have to admire how far they have come.

Wishing you all continued success!

name: Daisy Hawkins (Hope Series)
text: The most professional one stop shop for all that I needed.  This team landscaped the front and back, built a screened in patio.  Created and installed all new flagstone walkway and side patio and surrounding my new beautiful water fountain from their Aquascapes location at Hanna's Garden on 280.  Then painted my entire exterior on my house and addition.  Very professional, hard-working, and eager to accommodate any requests I had.  Highly recommend this group for your outdoor hardscape and landscape.  I loved not having to be the contractor on all these things.  They handled all for me.

name: Laerke Costov
text: Run as fast as you can in the opposite direction! Avoid at all costs!

name: R Daniel Chang
text: David came by for our consultation on time. He was very attentive to our questions and concerns. We're still in the process of making final decisions on contractors and builders but dsld is certainly at the top of the list.

name: Steve Skelton
text:
I could not be more pleased with this company! They are professionals in every sense of the word.
They have done multiple projects for myself and my wife. They are what I would call...outdoor wizards!
They have installed amazing landscape lighting for us, completely redesigned our shrub and flower beds, and installed the most awesome landscape masonry borders I’ve ever seen. I have a large fountain in one of the shrub beds in the front of my house. Mind you, this thing weighs like a bazillion lbs. I was recently trying to clean it out and get it ready for Spring and Summer. I accidentally let the bowl tip off the pedestal. Well, I tried to lift it up and get it back on the pedestal. I suppose I’m not as young as I used to be, because I couldn’t budge it. I really didn’t know what to do, so I called DSLD and asked if they could come by and get this monster back on the pedestal. It wasn’t more than a day later, when I got in from work when I noticed that my fountain was sitting upright, filled with water, just waiting to be plugged in. When I called Zach Sharp, ( a great young man by the way) to ask what I owed them, he absolutely refused to take a cent, saying it only took a few minutes and I could not get them to take anything for their time and trouble. In today’s world, qualities like that are rare. If you ever need any type of landscape architecture, a pool, anything “outdoorsy”,
These are the guys. They are 5 stars in every category and I could not give them a higher recommendation.
Don’t waste your money on shoddy work! Call DSLD . They are definitely the best!

Steve Skelton
Dunnavant Place at Highland Lakes

name: Jason Hall
text: DSLD does excellent work. It’s almost hard to believe it’s the same yard from before to after. The yards they have worked on and completed are the type of yards you would see on TV or magazines the quality is so good.

name: Heather Brown
text:
DSLD rescued our backyard garden! In March, we used another landscaping service to prepare landscaping beds and plant hydrangeas, roses, azaleas, camellias, gardenias, etc. The beds were not properly prepared, and the plants became diseased, stressed, and began to die very quickly. We also had a serious drainage problem.

DSLD determined why our new plants were failing, recommended solutions, and implemented their plan; amending the soil and replanting the plants we already had. They also solved our drainage problem. Now, we have a gorgeous backyard!!!

We highly recommend DSLD!

name: Lauren Clemons
text: Great communication and presentation of information on their entire pool building and landscape design process!  I appreciate the quick responsiveness and the professionalism so far.  Excited to get started on our back yard transformation project!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind reply. Look forward to working with you on the design.

name: Hughes Home
text: DSLD repaired our pool and got it running before spring was over. They did an outstanding job and were generous with their time and efforts. They have also provided valuable ILP lessons for the youth on our camous that will help them get started once they graduate HS.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your kind remarks. Our owner David Sharp enjoys teaching the independent living classes at kings home, and we were all happy to rebuild your swimming pool and wish you many years of swimming recreation and enjoyment.

name: Drew Ellis
text: Genuinely good people and very good at what they do. Arturo and his crew were very professional and made sure everything was done right. Stephen was easy to communicate with and a pleasure to work with. You get what you pay for with this crew.  We love our new backyard and patio.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Mr. Ellis. From design to implementation, It was a pleasure working with you and your family to bring your backyard living space to life!

name: Joe Limbaugh
text: Even though we did not select them as part of our bid process, they were very professional to deal with.

name: Lester Ruttka
text: DSLD does exceptional work, is efficient, fast, and reliable. Whether it is general landscaping or custom design they can't be beat.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Mr. Ruttka. It was a pleasure working for you!

name: Annilaurie
text: DSLD did a great job on are yard.  We love our beautiful new beautiful back yard and lighting.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words. It was a pleasure working with you to transform your backyard!

name: William Gilley
text: DSLD sets the standard for professionalism and integrity in creating amazing outdoor spaces. Their team works with you to create designs using the best quality products available. Their crews are efficient and well organized. They are honest and dependable and the quality of their finished work is second to none. I highly recommend using them for your next outdoor project.

name: David & Ann Swanson
text: Very knowledgeable and professional. Great job.  Pool and landscape look fantastic. Would highly recommend

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Mr. and Mrs. Swanson.

name: Alene Morgan
text: If you are looking for a landscaping company that will give you good professional advice in addition to responding to your specific request, DSLD would be a good bet.  Perhaps the best quality is the attitude of those involved in which you sense they really care to do a good job for you.

name: James Graham
text: I really enjoyed the planning process that DSLD took us through.

resp.text: Thank you! It was a pleasure working with you and your family!

name: Jason Carpenter
text: I have used DSLD numerous times and I am always 110% satisfied with the attention to detail and the final product of their work.  The DSLD team is always courteous, professional and respectful.  If your like me and don't have a vision for your lawn, call DSLD and let them handle it - you will not be disappointed.

name: Script Inspired
text: Very knowledgeable staff. Great care and attention to detail was taken when installing sod in my yard. Fantastic finished product!

name: bill rodgers
text: Did what they said they would. Mason is a true artist. Offered great design and additions as we went. Jason was a wonderful asset to have on my job. Will mark them as KEEPERS.

name: qb1_7 Wanderful1
text: A little arrogant if you ask me

name: Bryan Chace
text: Knowledgeable, professional, and excellent workmanship. Attentive service and estimates. They do what they say, and do it very well.

name: Jamie Berry
text: Great company to work with. Very knowledgeable and efficient. All around great group, I highly recommend.

name: mary pickett
text: We had just moved into our new custom home but had questions about some of the builder's construction decisions.  We wanted a neutral opinion.  We called DSLD and they promptly came to access our questions and did a complete review of the home.  Afterwards, we were provided a concise review of construction and systems.  They explained why the builder did certain things and advised on how to get things investigated/repaired.  I recommend DSLD.

name: tim roberts
text: I have performed a lot of work around these guys and they are the best in the business. I am an electrician and many time other trades only care about thier part  job. Their masons work with all the trades to make sure the customer gets the best project possible. I have never seen anything but  jobs of the highest quality around these guys and look forward to working around them again down the road.

name: Lou Eppolito
text: Design work was functional and attractive. Implementation was first rate. DSLD stands behind its work. Overall, a great experience!

name: Ron Boisclair
text: Exceptional client service, workmanship and a great team. Working with DSLD owner David Sharp was a pleasure. He responded to my inquiry within a day and met with me within a week to discuss options for landscape and drainage work on my Highland Lakes home--the $100 up-front consult fee was a worthwhile investment, and was applied to to the cost of my project. Work included expanding, grading, and sodding (Zoiysa) the backyard, which included construction of a 70 foot concave curved/step-graduated wall, installing a new drainage system along and under the driveway, and adding an external sump pump well and pump to move water from a tied-in roof downspout and overhead deck drain. DSLD completed the project in approx. 2 weeks.  Good communications throughout, with detail breakdown of proposal costs.  Definately recommend.

name: Stan Ingram
text: Pleasure to work with.  They did everything they promised in good time.

name: Jim Mason
text: Very professional staff. They assisted me in any way possible and were sure to follow up on my inquiry to see if I needed any additional help.

name: Brian Parrish
text: Professional, respectful, hard-working team that delivers top notch service! You will be happy with the results and so will your neighbors!

name: Justin Abercrombie
text: DSLD takes pride in the quality of work for each and every job. The company as a whole is very friendly, and makes the experience welcoming as well as rewarding.

name: Tim Kirksey
text: Staff is very courteous and professional. A fun place to shop!

name: David Sharp
text:
As an owner/operator I enjoy meeting new and old clients and working with some of the finest people I know.  Our employees stay put!  We have folks here going on three decades and and counting.
Don't take my word for it, call us today and put our professional team on your next project!

name: Russell Baker
text: Knowledgeable crew always showed up as scheduled and happy to coordinate their work with other Contractors. Pricing is not the cheapest but you get what you pay for

name: Nelson TAYLOR
text: Terrible follow up!!! I contacted DSLD for a replacement pool liner after visiting Aquascapes store. They would not provide photos of their work, references etc. Very obvious they are unqualified for such projects!

resp.text: Mr. Taylor, we apologize for our untimely follow up on your request.  You caught us at a very busy time and we have since hired the requisite personnel to ensure this does not happen again. At your inconvenience, please stop by AquaScapes anytime for a $25 credit on anything in our store.

name: Ed Bartlett
text: Extremely professional.  Cutting edge designs.  Top quality construction.

name: Lester Colindres
text:
It's been great working for DSLD
family oriented company.
Lots of opportunities to learn new skills.

name: Brady Pugh
text: DSLD is a dependable family owned and operated business that has unmatched customer satisfaction. Attention to detail, knowledge, and integrity are some of the values that this quality landscape company prides themselves in.

name: Griffin Hansen
text: Great landscaping company, and their chicken yard on Dunnavant is a lot of fun to see every day.

name: Leo Hernandez
text: Dsld gave me a great introduction to customer service and taught me about the workings of a successful small business. the company is family owned and operated, and it feels like you are with family when you are at work. Love Dsld and would recommend to anyone.

text: Love working here! I get time off for my school and i like how it's family operated!

name: Kelly Matthews

name: Michael Crump
text: We love how the project turned out and highly recommend DSLD.

name: Greg James

name: Frank McClure
text: Very professional, fixed my drainage issues, and repaired landscaping to desired condition.  Would use again.

name: KEITH JEWELL Straight-Line PARKING LOT MAINTENANCE
text: Great service good people to do business with

name: Cooper White
text: Very professional and got the job done quickly!

name: R Heffner
text: Phillips

name: Kelly Kiernan
text: Had my skimmers and pool liner replaced. They did an excellent job and went out of the way to make sure I was satisfied with the job. Recommend them to my friends and they had the same outcome. Great!

name: Ralph Ekonen
text: ASP replaced my liner in half the time they told me it would take.  Communication was excellent, service was excellent and prices were comparable.  I would definitely recommend this company.

name: Lori Rasmussen
text: Great company!! I was so impressed by their team’s responsiveness and honesty. Brad and Terrell provided outstanding customer service and were so helpful. Cannot say enough great things. I will definitely use them in the future!!

resp.text: Thank you Lori. We appreciate your business and your and Reid's service to our country.

name: Linda Mcintyre
text: ASP has done a wonderful job resurfacing my gunite pool!  They were punctual and professional and did everything they said they would do and more!  Brad was especially helpful in answering questions and in providing immediate help with any concerns!

resp.text: Thank you so much Mrs. McIntyre. It was and is a pleasure working for you. BC

name: julia armstrong
text: ASP recently replaced my pool's sand filter, pump, salt cell, rerouted my backwash hose, and cleaned my pool.  I am very pleased with the work, as well as the friendliness and professionalism of Brad and his team. ASP did an excellent job, used quality parts, and were on schedule. I feel like I received my money's worth. I will call on them in the future.

resp.text: Thank you Julia. We really appreciate your business.

name: Stephanie Starr
text:
I have hired several local pool companies over the years and have experienced at best mediocre pool service / cleaning. I finally hired ASP - America’s Swimming Pool and I can say this is a top notch company that cares about their customers and does what they say they will do.

I have told the owner several times that he needs to keep hold of Abel Rios. I am in the kitchen most times that he comes and have watched him. He does every single thing you have paid for regardless if it needs to be done or if he could easily skip that step without you knowing.  He does all of it...every single time he comes. I never question if he has been at the house to clean the pool. And he always takes pictures of the pool after servicing and sends them to you through email.

I have had other pool companies where I have questioned did they really do anything...for several months. I kept missing them when they were here. I finally was home and saw the guy literally walk in the back yard ...toss in a chlorine tab in the skimmer basket..come to my front door and leave the card stating he has been here and did this and that...which he had done none of. He didn’t even empty the skimmer basket. Upon calling the owner ...he gave the excuse of “ Well, he’s a big guy and doesn’t like to get down on his knees”. Unbelievable.

I highly recommend ASP. The service you will receive is worth every single penny.

resp.text: Thank you Stephanie. We appreciate you.

name: Natalie Patrick
text: We had a pool leak for over 1 year.  I had dealt with the company in Montgomery that put my pool in.  They came out, looked it over and stated that we needed to get a new liner since it was over 10 years old.  Their "theory" did not make sense to me because it would leak only some of the time.  I refused to spend the $2700 on the new liner and dealt with the "sometime leak".  We finally decided to give Brad Cole a call at ASP, and he quickly was able to determine the problem.  It was a very simple fix that saved us a lot of money.  I appreciate his time, honesty and helpfulness.  He asked questions and gave us great advice not only with our leak problem, but with maintenance tips that will help us maintain our pool better. My only regret is not calling him sooner.  It is nice to know that there are still good business people out there.

name: Anita Speir
text: This has been the worst experience I have ever had with a pool company. I've had a pool in Montgomery for years and have used Hughes as well as Mr. Pool, both of which were very professional. Brad, on the other hand, signed a contract in November for a drain and clean, and then outright lied to me telling me I mailed my check late, then told me he was at a funeral- and sent me pictures of it for some reason. After I offered my condolences and asked to reschedule he informed me he mailed my check back then asked why I wanted it done so soon... 3 months after I requested the drain and clean- I expected to wait this long due to the weather, but the week it was to be done Brad found every reason under the sun to refuse me service. I suspect the original quote he gave me of 900$ was too low ( I usually pay 1,200$) for him to complete the contract. I did not ask for the check to be sent back, or for it to be cancelled, so he voided a contract illegally. After I APOLOGIZED to him for asking for my services to be rendered, even once again offering my condolences for his loss, I assumed his erratic behavior was because of this, Brad still snubbed me, telling me we didn't communicate well. His texts to me were strange and obnoxious and I was completely confused the entire time I had to deal with him. Terrell, however, was pretty helpful and tried to answer my questions to the best of his knowledge.

resp.text: Ms. Speir, This is Brad. Thank you for your review. Since you live in Denver, Colorado we didn't get the opportunity to meet face to face or even speak on the phone for that matter but I believe I would have avoided my mistakes if we would have had the opportunity to do either. It has been my experience and strongly held belief that text messaging is a poor means of communicating one's thoughts or interpreting the meanings of others. Therefore, it is 100% my fault for relying on this means of communication with a potential customer. This was against my best judgement and I was wrong. I sincerely apologize for your having had a negative experience with our company, specifically with me. I will remember and use this experience to better myself and avoid these strategic mistakes that lost the company a valued potential customer. Kind regards, Brad Cole

name: Fan Yu
text: I was in the process of purchasing a house which needed a number of costly renovations that just so happened to include the pool. Well, pool might be a bit of stretch to describe what in fact appeared to be in the process of becoming a protected wetland. The pool, like the house, was in a state that was the result of years upon years of deferred maintenance. I called several companies with ASP being among the first. And before I continue, let me say that many of these companies won't even call you back, answer their phones or come out for visits like they say so ASP is ahead of the curve just for that reason alone. Brad was exceptionally busy with it being the beginning of the pool season, which he told me right off, and that he would try to get over to the house to inspect the pool. The price I was told it might take to get the pool in a usable state took my breath away! But I wasn't too surprised by it. He stated several times that it could be a little more or much less depending on what was found beneath the cover and behind walls. He was sure to prepare me for the worst. However, after that initial few calls and the visit, I didn't hear back from them. This wasn't a major problem because there was roofing and foundation issues to tend to before swimming could even be considered. Why would you need a backyard water feature when the roof itself was becoming one all by itself? Being that I needed someone to get out to do it fairly quickly once it came time address it, I called another company and they gave me a lower quote and could get started fairly quickly. Well, that went bust because we required a contractor with insurance, just in case of a problem. This guy didn't have it and didn't tell us until AFTER he was supposed to show up to do the job. I called and then he lets me know all that. ABSOLUTELY UNPROFESSIONAL BEHAVIOR that seems to be the hallmark of many service businesses like that these days. I was ready to just put the pool stuff off for awhile until I could find someone trustworthy until Brad calls out-of-the-blue! Just in time!! I was glad because, honestly, I really wanted to work with them from the start due to the good reviews on Google. Not only have they performed all the work needed so far, they did it for WELL under what they told me initially. It seems they prefer to brace you for the worst rather than underestimate costs just to get the job. We have a few more issues to address with the pool, again from the previous owners, that I'm sure Brad will help us iron out. These people have been tremendous and I can't say enough good things about them. They do what they say they're going to do, are available anytime just about and HONEST. I will only call ASP for any of my pool needs. Save yourself some frustration, money and anxiety--CALL ANGIE AND BRAD AT ASP!!!!!! Love them!!!!

text: Words aren't enough to describe what an awesome experience I have had in regards to ASP of Montgomery. Within minutes of reaching out to ASP of Montgomery I was able to receive a quote for services and thoroughly explained what to expect. The attention to detail provided, overall customer service, as well as timely responses has by far exceeded my expectations. My pool is the bluest I have seen it in 3 years and is therefore the reason I will be contracting there services for routine cleanings. I am beyond greatful.

text: Several months ago I purchased a home with a pool.  I initially used a different pool business for the pre-purchase inspection and the first few months of maintenance. name: Charles Jones
text: What a pleasant surprise!!  I have a 12,000 gallon KOI pond that is 4 ft. deep and has 2 large bottom drains and a skimmer that feed a filter system much like that of a swimming pool except the media in the filter is plastic beads instead of sand.  It pumps 9,000 gallons of water through the system an hour and runs 24 hours a day.  The water after passing through the filter returns over a waterfall back into the pond.  There are 2 large river birch trees that overhang the pond and the shed a lot of leaves and small twigs into the pond.  Over time I had an accumulation on the bottom of the pond and the drain pipes running under the pond had stopped up and after a routine backwash of the pond the pump lost its prime and I was unable to restart it.  I got the bright idea that since it was similar to a swimming pool to call a swimming pool maintenance company for help.  I looked on the internet and found and called ASP.  Brad answered the phone and when I described my problem he said he could help and he could come 2 days later.  When I explained that I had 60 large KOI fish that required the water flow to keep the water oxygenated he said he was leaving for an appointment and would come as soon as he finished.  He worked on my problem the rest of the day and returned the next morning and got everything working great.  He also altered the plumbing to give me the ability to blow out trash in the drain line.  He found a problem with the multiport valve which we decided needed replacing and added a shut off valve on the waste line to solve the problem until I could get a replacement.  He was great to work with and communicated his findings and suggestions well and his pricing was very reasonable.  I plan to use his service on a regular basis.

text: We have been so happy with the work Matthew has done for us.  As a matter of fact, we will never call anybody but Swimple pools. When we couldn't find anybody else in a two county radius that would come out to help us we got blessed to find him!  5 stars!!!!!  Call him.  You won't regret it!!!

name: jamie keith
text: DO NOT USE!!! We hired them to open our pool, replace sand and check plumbing. The water was green so I know it takes a little time. They sent the cleaning employee out 4 times and he shocked and flocked it. I have no problem with him. He tried but it still remained light green. So fast forward a week I go by the store to get a new bucket and talk to the lady about our pool. I was told the owner is the only one that can change the sand or check plumbing. We'll thats fine as well except the owner never calls or even follows up behind his employees to make sure they are doing things properly ,this is important when your told well the pool boy is learning . The lady then tells me that WE need to shock and brush and backwash. So let me get this straight you want us to clean our pool while you are not there making your job easier so you can collect the cash. Surly I'm not the only one that sees a problem with me paying them for a service I am doing. I understand me backwashing and keeping an eye on the filter while they are not there and I'm good with that.I canceled and still have never heard from the owner. I never leave reviews but please stay away. You only important if you are spending thousands at his business

name: Holly Hinchman
text: DO NOT use Swimple pools! My husband bought an above ground pool in February. It wasn’t the cheapest either, but you pay for what you get, or so we thought. So they come out to install Thursday before Memorial Day. While digging they find a “sink hole” as they called it. It was an unfilled perc test. We filled it in that weekend and let them know. (This is NOT their fault, just setting up for the next two weeks it hasn’t been dealt with.)That next week we are told the installation would resume. Later that week the installer said he would be out Friday and that someone needed to be there to sign “sink hole” liability papers. Saturday comes still no show or call. So my husband calls the owner. We ask if we could get our money back, and husband tells him their contracted installer won’t call or show up like he’s promised several days to do. After that the installer calls immediately and says he will be out Monday. He comes for 30 minutes. He comes back Tuesday and digs it out and leaves because of weather ( didn’t rain). Thursday my husband asks when we can expect him again. He gives another day and says once again he promised it would be up, my husband told him if he couldn’t keep that commitment then we would find someone else. He told us to go ahead and find someone else. So, I go to the store front and speak to the lady in there. She was very defensive of the whole situation, said we couldn’t have our money back because pools are special order. So I ask when it would get installed. She said she didn’t know. Mathew would do it. She then told me the installer was in tears over us. I tried showing her the screenshots of the conversation to prove we weren’t rude and was simply needing someone to come when they say. I asked to speak with the owner, she refused to give me his information and told me to leave or she was calling the police. I had my children with me who were scared she was saying that. I was not disrespectful. We left as requested. Still no word from anyone 5 hours later. Total disrespect to my property, my time and my kids.

name: Bronson McLain
text:
Valley Pools just completed our pool for us and we absolutely LOVE it!  I still walk out my back patio or look out the window and I still almost can't believe how nice it is!  My back yard looks like it belongs in a resort!  I had been in contact with another local pool company who came out twice to give me a "quote."  Neither time did they give me an exact price.  It was always a ball park figure.  With a project of this magnitude, I need real numbers!  Also, this contractor was adamant that I did NOT want a salt water pool which goes against EVERYTHING that I've heard from anyone has experience with pools.  All you ever hear is that salt water pools was the way to go.  So, I thought that maybe he was just being really honest, so I believed him.  But his lack of real numbers and honestly his lack of enthusiasm caused me to shop around for another quote.  I spoke with Ronnie from Valley Pools that same afternoon and he gave me more information over the phone that the other pool guy had in two trips to my house!  I had told him that I was thinking about not going to a salt water pool based on what another pool contractor had told me.  Keep in mind, I didn't tell him who I had spoken to.  As soon as I said those words, Ronnie said "That wasn't such and such pool company was it?"  He was dead on!  He knew all about them and I wasn't the first to tell him this.  He explained to me that they this particular pool company hated salt water pools and didn't know how to properly maintain them and that they would rather have you buying chemicals from them.  Ronnie changed my mind on the spot!

Once Ronnie was actually able to come out and see my back yard, he was straight and to the point.  My yard had a significant hill that sloped upwards which would require a lot of excavation and then required a retaining wall.  He said that he welcomed the challenge and began laying out his vision for how the retaining wall would look.  He recommended that instead of squaring it off around the pool that we curve the wall around it in a half moon shape!  It's awesome!  I was so excited about all of the possibilities that I was ready to go right then!  And on the spot, he gave me an exact price and we signed the contract right then and there!

He tells you upfront to allow 4-8 weeks for completion.  We obviously were shooting for the 4 week mark.  But things happen.  Ours was completed in 6 weeks.  We were really hoping to have it completed for our daughters' birthday party.  I told Ronnie about the party and he made sure it got done!  It took all the way until the day before the party, but we had a pool party that next day!  I had daily phone calls with Ronnie on the schedule and what would be happening that day and the next and so on.  I can honestly say that although we would have liked it to have been completed a little sooner, he made our hard deadline!  But, it's easy to be impatient when building a pool.  There's a lot of excitement involved!  I have already recommended Valley Pools to all of my coworkers and friends interested in getting a pool.  I have absolutely no complaints!

I said sure, no problem because I was still excited about the pool.  I even made an outline of my pool with a very long string. I am a business owner myself, and I know that people have a choice where to spend their money.  Other than the nice lady I spoke with at their office, Valley Pools are very unprofessional and unreliable .  I literally thanked God that I didn't give them my business because I could only imagine the grief that would've followed.

Here we are in 2014 and he never followed up to complete my pool after call after call...I finally had to hire someone to come in and do analysis on my pool and quote me to complete the process...Worst company worst service ever...want to see what my pool looks like...you are more than welcome to come by my home and see the workmanship of Valley Pool.  I would never recommend this company to anyone!!!!!

text:
I've been with Valley Pools for 11 years.  Just 5 years ago I spent over 7K for a new liner, conversion to salt water cell, automated Hayward control panel, and new Hayward pump.  This weekend, my pump overheated and failed.  I stop by this morning to buy a replacement pump and they wanted to charge me 499.99 for a new pump and motor.  On Amazon the same pump was 329.99, plus free shipping and no taxes.  That's a 170.00 dollar difference or better yet a 51.5% mark up.  Personally I do not mind a pass through mark up cost, but 52% from an internet business is unreasonable.  She (the manager) was unwilling to work with me on a lower price and in the process lost a local customer for life.
Carey
Meridianville, AL

text: Ryan  and his crew showed up on a Saturday  to get the project started. Our family has some special circumstances and Ryan came up with some great ideas to help meet those needs so that all members of my family can enjoy the pool to the fullest. Great crew. Hard workers. name: Karen Moltz
text:
First I would like to say the pool itself shows beautifully. However, from the start Mr. Pool and his management team, Chris where sweet talkers until they received our money. The cement work is ofthe poorest quality I have seen as to date.  Also the responsiveness from the company to repair our cement that they poured in the rain has boasted both poor workmanship rotten customer service. When asked why they poured it in the rain in the first place, the response was because they were behind in their work and had other pools to start. We have been promised for over 6 months they would repair the pitting and cracks not only in the cement but in the border around the pool which has started to crumble into the pool itself. I do realize they did give us a textured concrete at no cost to hide all the pitting and holes we were left with, and do appreciate that but the pitting has returned and mud is coming up from underneath the cement through the holes.  We have documented over dozens of calls and voice mails always to receive "we will come out" or "oh we will stop by next week" or "you didn't verify that we could come" after we asked dozens of times for someone to come out. I have finally had to resort to legal counsel from an attorney and will have to proceed in court. When I phoned Mr. Ryan last year with a problem before the pool was actually finished he replied saying "I have over 200 phone calls weekly, I can't get to every one of them, lady what do  you want me to do?"  This is an example of the worst customer service ever, I spent $41,000 on an L shaped 35,000+ gallon pool, with them and I am treated as if I am unreasonable because I need some repairs done while under my 1 year warranty. I really hope they are not trying to forfeit my warranty by putting me off so that the warranty will expire and they will not have to do the repairs.. I will not recommend them to anyone at this time. I am sorry it has resorted to legal counsel and bad reviews but my husband and I have reached our limit of no help.
Karen Wright - unhappy in Duncanville

name: Dan Taylor
text:
We had a pool installed this month December of 17. We chose to go with the True L shape 18x36x42 as it provides plenty of room for guests with younger children and then a separate deep end for the older kids and adults. The design we chose also has a tanning ledge with bubbler. It's 14 inches deep which kind of negates the tanning functionality without the addition of some specially design pool loungers that won't harm the vinyl liner.

I had already received 3 quotes prior to calling Mr. Pool (Ryan) There's one particular company that I will not name here that I was particularly concerned about the finished concrete work on the pool deck. I have a neighbor who has had several issues with his pool deck. The company gave them a free deck coating which is peeling 3 years later. On yet another pool that company just installed in September they also had to put down a coating to try and cover up their poor workmanship. Mr. Pool was out bid by this company on both of these pool builds.

When Ryan came to our home I was immediately impressed when we began our walk through around the backyard for the layout of the pool. He immediately picked up on our house having a septic system and marked the field lines just by sight. (I had not put the Winter low cut on the yard at the time) We walked around marking the yard for the pool. By this point in the bidding process I knew some more pertinent questions to ask. (I was ill informed by 2 of the prior bids about anything the pool would have and upgrade options available).  I knew I wanted to have 2in plumbing which wasn't the other companies standards and I wanted a 3hp pump and possibly even a variable speed pump to save money on electrical costs.

I asked Ryan what size his plumbing would be. He stated he uses 2in plumbing. The other companies stated they use 1.5" plumbing. I asked Ryan what HP pump and he stated a 3HP. The others stated 1.5HP.
I asked how many returns would be used which he replied there would be 8 due to the size of the pool. The other companies were going to be installing 3-4.  I was very pleased to hear these responses and we went inside to put everything on paper and figure out the rough draft of the concrete pool deck.

He drew it out and we agreed on the layout pending the septic system layout I'd have to pull from the health department. I mentioned as he began to write the quote out that I may be interested in the variable speed pump if it saves on energy costs. He stated it definitely does and that we'd only see an increase of $30-$50 a month by going with VS pump. He quoted me with automation included.

During the build just before the concrete was to be poured I noticed a spot that I just really felt I'd like to have concrete instead of the way we originally had it. I contacted Ryan and he informed me what the added cost would be which was very reasonable for what needed to be done.

The concrete job is nearly perfect and I say that because concrete really is never perfect. The finished product delivered is far above what I have seen of others. He also takes extra steps in the preparation to ensure years of even concrete with little chance of settling or cracking.

The crews during each stage are knowledgeable and friendly with us sharing in some laughs often.

I recommend the upgrades in automation and your pump. Swing for the ability to run your pool from your phone as it'll save you time from running to and from the panel and if you have a waterfall and or a LED bubbler it will remove the risk of causing problems (expense) by not opening or closing the proper valves in the right sequence.

If I were to ever need another pool installed I'd call one company and save myself time and money. That company would be Mr. Pool.

I hope that you will choose them as I did,  I'm confident you'll receive the same great product and service I did.

name: Jennifer van Arcken
text: Not at all pleased with this Mr. Pool Company. They submitted a review for our next door neighbor's pool to the Neighboored  Review Committee with a 15-foot "mistake." Instead of installing the pool in the middle of  their very large backyard, they installed it less than 10 foot from our fence. They brought in dirt at least four feet of dirt to surround the pool, so now we can see our neighbors walking around their pool from their knees up. You can see from the picture how much dirt is up against our 6-foot fence. I brought this issue to the company's attention before the concrete was poured  and requested they fix. I told them this elevated pool would cause drainage issues in oir yard and would impact privacy. Chris Pierce the foreman over the job actually told me if I wanted privacy I should have moved to the country. This is the same pool company that replaced our pool liner a few years ago. So much for customer satisfaction, quality control and so much for strict neighborhood covenants.

name: Kenny Eaton
text: I contacted Mr. Pool about removing wrinkles in the vinyl liner in my pool. Their rep came out and informed me that the large wrinkles would not come out but they could drain and clean the pool and remove the small wrinkles. When they were done, none of the wrinkles had been removed and now there were new wrinkles in the deep end where, previously, there had been no wrinkles. Also there were three tears in the liner that previously weren't there. They applied small patches to the tears but one patch was improperly applied and doesn't even fully cover the tear. I feel my liner was in better shape before Mr. Pool drained and cleaned it. I would not recommend Mr. Pool in Montgomery Alabama for pool maintenance.

name: Alan Smith
text: Last December, we approached Anders Pool Company, to install a new liner in our in-ground swimming pool. In beginning, the staff were extremely polite, courteous , knowledgeable  and pleasant to interact with. We picked out the pattern we wanted, and paid 50% of the total cost, to cover the  price of manufacturing the liner which, was very reasonable indeed. Steve came out in late December, to take the measurements of the pool, to pass onto the liner manufacturer. We then agreed to call Anders Pool, early March, to set a date to install the liner. I called Anders Pool, March 9th, and spoke with Steve, and set the date to install the new liner on Wednesday, March 27th. Steve touched base with me, a few days before the install date, to make sure we were good to go. Chris and two other staff, arrived early Wednesday, and drained the pool with a gas pump. They removed the old liner, thoroughly, and I mean thoroughly, cleaned, the pool walls and floors, smoothed over the pool floor and installed the new liner without any issues at all. Then, they set up a vacuum pump and a set a vacuum hose between the pool wall and the pool liner, to suck the trapped air out as we filled the pool from the faucet. The Anders pool liner installers, were extremely Professional and polite throughout the entire operation. They did a fantastic job, far, far, better than their local competition, that I'd used for the two previous liners, over the past 30 years. This liner fits snuggly up against the 4 ft. radius walls of the pool. Anders Pool, took the time, to accurately measure the pools dimensions. The previous pool company, when measuring up, rounded down the measurements, to get an even number. Which, resulted in a poor fitting liner. If you need a new pool liner, make sure you get a quote from Anders Pool Company. Trust me, they'll get you the best price and, the best quality liner, and the best possible installation. This company is well worth my 5 star rating.

name: Matt Ezell
text:
If you like simple projects turned nightmare, this is a post for you...

$3,000 spent on a simple re-tile job, months of frustration, damage to our property, and within months our pool looks far worse than it did before.

We now have additional significant damage as a result of them improperly attempting to do the job multiple times that we’re going to have to pay to have fixed (coping bricks separating from pad due to shifting due to multiple improper drainings). And of course we now have to pay someone else to do the tile job we already paid Swimming Pool Services for.

Swimming Pool Services drained our fiberglass pool twice (tried for a 3rd before I told them to stop) without first sumping (we have a sump line - they indicated they didn’t know what it was), they used no bracing any of the 2 times they drained our pool, and then left it empty during rainy days - look up ‘drain fiberglass pool’ to learn how terrible this all is. The whole time, they’ve dismissed our concerns via long drawn out email back and forths and continue to assert that they did everything correctly and are trying to help. After they failed to make things right, I requested a refund, which they’ve refused - they will only agree to keep sending guys out to redo portions of the job the same way that resulted in the problems that we have today. It's always worth mentioning that what was estimated to be a "2 to 3 day job" took more than a month - lots of no call/no show and terrible communication across the board. No thanks.

I’ve since spoken to multiple other local FIBERGLASS experts as well as the manufacturer, all of whom assert this was 100% NOT done correctly (with the owner and manager have simply dismissed this, acting as if we’ve only learned info from the Internet. Despite every other expert and resource saying SPS is wrong, SPS continues to assert that they are the experts, even having gone as far as attacking other local businesses work). I’ve been asked no less than 3 times “are you sure they were reputable?”. The manufacture literally put me on speakerphone so everyone could hear my story, to which they responded with gasps, “oh my” and “I’m so sorry”. The warranty manager actually said “it’s a good thing you didn’t have any remaining warranty because that would have definitely voided it - we wouldn’t touch it now”. I’ve also been told that the tiles, grout and adhesive used for the job are incorrect for this size/shape/type of pool, which is something that SPS vehemently argues against - I’ll attach some pictures of the current state of our pool so that you can be the judge for yourself.

The Manager (Dave) AND Owner (Glenn) will act as if they’re trying to help, but it’s seemingly just an act to keep things looking positive online (look here and at the BBB for examples). In conversations they remain friendly/polite, but will only offer to continue doing the very things that have led to us now having a damaged pool. I fully anticipate that the owner will follow up on all reviews acting as if they’ve tried to make things right, just as he seemingly does on all negative reviews, but their idea of making things right is continuing to do things incorrectly - ‘the customer is always wrong’, seems to be their approach to customer service. No thanks.

Unfortunately there’s a max character count for reviews, so I can’t share everything - though I will be elsewhere.

I personally wouldn’t allow these guys to put a bag of salt in my pool going forward.

Update based on owner's claims:
- The response, as expected, is full of misleading statements in an attempt to come across more helpful than is actually the case.
- I turned them away ONCE, not several times. I turned them away because they refused to proceed with repairs without 100% draining my pool and indicated that properly bracing it was out of the question.
- Notice he's not mentioning the 'remedy' that they proposed? Because they didn't propose a remedy. They said they would 100% drain my pool, and would not brace it - which is actually the opposite of a remedy.

resp.text: Matt, I am sorry that you feel this way and felt it necessary to resort to social media! We have been attempting to communicate with you and correct the tile issue which we have explained previously. We have tried several times to complete the work on this project and have been turned away each time. Any work would require lowering the level some at this point which is all that was to be done. We have done many projects like this with no issues and the remedy we proposed should take care of any future shifting as fiberglass pools are prone to do. I would be glad to speak with you personnaly to discuss either completion or other resolutions.  Please also note for reviews online that there is always more to the story...

company as well as the customer until the matter is resolved.  I was present that night and directed Mr Hood to

And asked if we could handle it another way, which we have, you now have a mechanic Lien in place. The truth of the matter is you refused to make payment when given a bill, and just as one of your prior contractors told us, you would haggle prices, when given the bill you stated you had to go and see what had to be fixed and haven’t even stepped foot on the site. So I instructed Mr Hood to give you something to fix.  There is the matter of clearing and bringing to
Grade the back yard prior to the dig on the pool 4 hours work that you still owe. The Mechanic lien will stay in place.

resp.text: Again this is a totally false post. Have never seen you on this site, there is no way you have first hand knowledge as to what has transpired. There was no refusal to make payment and in fact payment was offered that was never picked up. Not sure who you say is a prior contractor but this is also inaccurate. There was also no "haggling" of price and Mr. Hood gave a price too low for the job and we agreed to pay more even though we could have held to the original price offered by Mr. Hood. Mr. Hood was offered a draw on the job which was done improperly and never completed. Please stop the harassing posts and text.

name: Kari Snipes
text: Only one star... I wouldn’t have given even a one star! These people cut off my pool ladder and rain that was on the steps going into the pool when they came to close it at the end of the year. Today they came to open it and were supposed to put ladder and rail back on, as well has fix a pipe that is letting water out.  They left a ROCK on top of the leak and told us to go to Lowe’s to buy a pipe. They didn’t put the handrail back on bc of a crack in the cement. (Which they should’ve seen before taking it off when they closed the pool) so now, there is a big sharp piece of metal coming up out of our concrete.  The ladder has a huge gap. It’s totally UNACCEPTABLE. I would not recommend these people.

resp.text: Ms. Snipes, I'm sorry that you felt the need give this rating. I have spoken to both of the Technicians that came to your pool and they talked to and walked the pool with your husband when they completed your pool opening. The ladder and handrail were removed at homeowner request in the Fall. Our Technician spoke with your husband about a pipe that he broke. We don't typically carry adapters for that size pipe and gave your husband the option of us returning to repair and gave instruction on repair if he wanted to save the cost of our return. Our Technicians had the parts to repair and reinstall your rail goods but along with your husband determined that the concrete surrounding the rails were in too bad condition to install them at this time. Our Technician has tried to contact your husband since your review to discuss what happened since he was pleased when they spoke with him before they left. Please feel free to contact me if you would like to discuss. 205-601-3385 ask for Glen.

I kid you not...a service company doesn't want multiple issues to service. She's not in sales, but she's no better at customer service. The lady you spoke with tried to explain correctly the reasons for this. We try to look out for the best interest of our customers while protecting our Technicians and their time. I hope you can see your way to remove this review. This is only because you didn't like the answer you received and we hope you find someone that can meet your expectations.
