name: Mr B
text:
I called 5 different companies trying to hire someone to open/clean my pool, and change the sand in the filter. Three said they didn't provide the services and two never showed.  Then I found Swimming
Pool Services. From the moment Ashton answered the phone I knew I was dealing with a professional and reputable company. They gave  me a price  and schedule my service( I called on a Friday afternoon and they were at my house on the following Monday afternoon) .  The service staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and highly professional.  I would highly recommend Swimming Pool Services.  The experience was outstanding!!!!  I will be making an appointment soon to have the pool closed and winterized.  Thanks to all of you that I interacted with during this service!!

resp.text: Mr. B, Thanks for your review. We look forward to working with you in the future.

name: Michael Ray
text: These guys do amazing work! On time and professional. They were highly recommended and did not disappoint.

name: William Phillips
text: Glen and his team of professionals will take great care of you and your pool needs!

resp.text: Thanks for the kind comments William.

name: Lisa Caldwell
text: So easy to work with! Reliable service on my schedule! Would totally recommend!

resp.text: Thanks Lisa, we like working with you also!

name: LAURA MANSEL
text: Good service, staff was professional. Would recommend

resp.text: Thanks Laura we appreciate your business!

name: Nicole Morris
text: Great service and prices!! Highly recommend!!

resp.text: Thanks Nicole, we appreciate your business!

name: Sandra Wilder
text: It’s a shame that more people that have great experiences don’t leave reviews! When someone is impossible to please,  they are very quick to leave a negative review.   I actually contacted these guys last because of the review rating and that was a big mistake! The service was excellent not to mention the cost will be over half the cost of everyone else.  As a matter of fact I haven’t paid a penny yet and the pool is ready!  They were on time and our pool went from  A mosquito maternity ward to Crystal clear in less than a week!   If you are not a pool professional then I would be contacting these folks to take care of your pool! Relieve yourself of some stress and make the call.  🤗😎

resp.text: Ms. Wilder, Thank you for your review and I agree totally with your comments. I am glad we could help you out.

name: Nadia Wilder
text: Friendly and professional service!  Great in-store help with weekly water testing, advice on chemicals and treatments, etc.  Whether you want regular maintenance service or prefer to DIY,  this place can help keep your pool looking perfect year-round!

resp.text: Thanks Nadia, we appreciate your business!

name: Hayley Douglas
text:
Very poor customer service on the owners end.  After a mistake was made on my pool I requested to speak to someone in charge and was told the owner would call me.  I've waited over 3 weeks for a call and not once has he tried to get in touch with me.  I called back several times requesting to speak to him only to be told "he wasn't in and would call me back".
Horrible customer service to not even return a call. He should have reached out to me the second he heard about the mistake.  Granted I do have a small above ground pool but I'm still a paying customer.  We will never shop here again or recommend this business to anyone.

Edited to add after owners response... The things you stated are false.  I did provide a picture of my pool along with the dimensions of it to your staff member.  She put 12'x30' (feet) instead of 12'x30"(inches).  Also, I was told multiple times by your staff that YOU would call me or when I would call back to try to get you they would tell me something you said so I know there was some communication going on.  Another thing I was NOT asking for free chemicals.  I even told the girl that when I went back in in person to have the water checked again to see how bad was. I'm not sure where the miscommunication is happening between you and your staff but that needs to change.   But when someone leaves a review it is that person sharing their experience, good AND bad, they had with that particular business.

resp.text: Ms. Douglas, I am truly sorry if you were trying to reach me but I did not have a message to call as after speaking with my staff, they said they handled your issue and after hearing about what happened they did handle it exactly as I would have. We can't be responsible for chemical dosages used when we are not given the proper gallons for your pool. Our dosages given are all based on information that is supplied by our customers unless we send a Technician out to the pool to measure and get accurate volumns. My staff in an effort to help after getting the proper size of your pool did in fact give you chemicals at no charge to treat. My understanding is that you wanted a continuing supply of chemicals at no charge. We make every effort to ensure that you have what you need and are very conservative when dosing a pool typically, however in this case the overdosing was not something we could control based on the information that we had. Social media and review sites are an easy way to try to hurt a smalll business when we are trying to do the right things. If you would like to discuss now that I know you would like to speak with me offline please send a contact number to my email at gij@swimmingpoolservices.net and I assure you that I will call you to discuss. Again, sorry if there was any misunderstanding but feel free to reach out to me by email.

name: shannon Mcrae
text: Christy was amazing! Definitely going back!

name: Brice Jackson
text: Great facility! Knowledgeable and friendly staff. If you have any questions regarding a pool or spa, Swimming Pool Services will be very helpful!

name: Michael Weber
text: Glen was kind enough to help me trouble shoot my Polaris.  He made several suggestions on things I can do to improve my pool experience and they've all been true.  I highly recommend Swimming Pool Services for their expertise and professionalism!

name: Robert Evans
text: We are very happy with the work that we had done on our pool. So happy to have found some honest contractors who do what they say they will do and keep us in the loop along the way.

name: Ryan Brasher
text: Great people with visible passion for the work they do. Always a pleasure doing business with this company.

name: steve lessing
text: Great place to find all of your pool supplies. I have used their cleaning services for over a year. Friendly staff and great customer service.

name: Tommy Daspit
text: Amazing attention to detail and knowledge. Been working with them for 2 years. Highly recommend them to everyone I know with a pool!

name: Valerie Sawyer
text: We have been shopping here for several years. Great staff in the store and they did a great job on our liner. They always make sure we are satisfied and have helped solve chemical problems. They even came out on a freezing Saturday morning to repair the pump and avoid further problems from the cold!

name: Amy Self
text: Great customer service and very professional.

name: James Brown
text: I used swimming pool services for all of my pool maintenence.  I never had to worry about the condition. Very professional company with competitive prices.

name: Dave Stephenson
text: I have worked with swimming pool services and used  them personally. If you want an experienced, quality and honest company company to deal with Swimming pool services are definitely the company to use.

name: Dale Pangman
text: Very dissatisfied. We had been using Swimming Pool Services (SPS) since we moved into our home in 2008. They opened and closed our pool each season and we bought our chemicals for our pool and hot tub from them as well. The last few years, the service began to drop. When we called to complain, we were told it's hard finding good help. In Oct 2012, we bought a hot tub from them. In Oct 2016, the hot tub quit running. When the repairman came out, he said we needed to buy a new pump. After waiting a few days for SPS to give us an estimate on a new pump, my wife called the maker of the hot tub, Shoreline Dynasty Spa, and got an estimate from them. We decided to try to fix it ourselves and took the pump to Alabama Pump and Supply who fixed it for much less. We then reinstalled it. After reinstalling the pump, we decided to move the spa a few feet and called SPS and were told Glen would call us back shortly as he was on a job. I waited until 2 PM. When I called back, I was told they wouldn't be able to help us until sometime the next week. TIME TO MOVE ON. We had experienced poor service many times over the years, but weren't sure who to use. Thanks to SPS's poor service, we now open and close our pool and we use Shoemaker pool services for our supplies.

name: Tracy Tindle
text: Friendly staff and very helpful in the store!

name: Leta Goolsby
text: Great place to buy Swimming Pool Supplies!

name: Leta Goolsby
text: Great place to buy Swimming Pool Supplies!

name: Bill Koehler
text: Very good service and knowledge for all Pools and Hot Tubs. Honest and thorough service department, which unfortunately is difficult to find these days. Fully custom pool builders. They also service Hot Tubs not purchased here.

name: Shannon Lambeth
text: I HIGHLY recommend using a DIFFERENT company. This company is terrible. My wife and I just bought a home and it already had an in ground pool. I called this company, spoke with a very nice and informative woman only to be given the wrong information. I was told for my pool opening they would come check my system and make sure everything worked properly, remove the cover, pour chemicals into the water and clean and vacuum the pool for $325. Upon arrival, they were here about 15 minutes, checked nothing, poured two things into my pool, only for it to still be green 3 days later. I have yet to receive any information as to what my bill is, what they did, next steps, etc. I called the company to ask when they would be back to clean and was told they won’t be coming back and if I wanted them to clean, it would be $150 extra. They also did not install the ladder or check my equipment, as I realized there are two leaks and a gauge not working. I told the woman who scheduled it that I was unhappy with my service and felt like I didn’t get what I paid for and was told I would get. Her response wasn’t, “I’m sorry for the misinformation, we will correct this immediately” nor did she offer some sort of refund. She basically accused me of lying and said, “sorry you feel that way.” This company does not care about their customers, only the profit. If I would’ve known I was paying for them to come take the cover off and pour two things in my pool and not even make sure the water would clear up, I would’ve NEVER agreed to this. Do not use this company, they will let you down and treat you like you’re just more money.

name: Bob Brasher
text: Johnson Pools installed an in ground salt pool and spa with water feature. The grout in the spa continues to fall out even though they did re-grout once. The problem is they put about an inch space at the top before the first row of tiles. There is too much space and the grout cracks and falls out. They also installed a Pentair system that controls everything. I’ve had multiple ongoing issues with this system. My lights do not work properly. I can’t control the feature with my phone app. I have to go to the equipment and cut it on and off manually. Currently the spa won’t come on at all by using the app and you can’t turn it on manually. The maximum temperature on the spa will just reset itself for no apparent reason. The light in the spa is bad and won’t change colors. They said they would replace it but it has been about a year and it hasn’t been replaced. They have one service person and he seems capable but stretched very thin. He solves one problem but then another will appear. Something is up with the Pentair system but no one seems to know how to fix it. We paid more to use Johnson Pools because at one time they had a good reputation for quality and service. I must say this has not been my experience. I spoke with one of the owners and she was borderline rude in the phone and I still have several unsolved issues. I couldn't recommend this company in good conscience.

name: Nathan Goldsmith
text: I have been working on a hot tub repair project and they have been extremely helpful in buying parts for it. I am glad I have a Sundance hot tub so I can shop local for parts and be able to ask questions regarding different issues that arise.

name: Debbie Vickers
text: Very helpful with chemicals and my pool

name: DeeAnn Kizziah
text: So very helpful!  They had in stock half of what we needed.  The other half, a part for my spa, was researched by staff to see if they could get it for us.  I didn't even have to ask them to do this!  Customer service at its finest!

name: Lauryn Mcnair
text: Very nice and  friendly answered all my questions!

name: Dawn P
text: Exactly what I needed. Staff helpful. Quickly in and out.

name: Paul Christian
text: Better if they would build me a water feature like they have in their showroom.

name: Susan Slagle
text: It was a pleasure to deal with Cathy Castle when I needed parts for our sand filter.  She was knowledgeable,  friendly and went out of her way to locate the parts we needed.  The price was right, the parts were perfect and I intend to call Johnson Pools first when future needs arise.  I will definitely recommend her and the company to any friends with pool problems.

name: Lateshia Seay
text: The service was exceptional. I told them my issues. The walked me through the solution to my problem step by step so I could understand what to do. I recommend them to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you so much :)

name: Robert Hayden
text: Johnson pool has a very courteous and knowledgeable  staff and they have what you need in store.

name: Matthew Houston
text: I can't say stay away from this place strongly enough. They are OK if you just need chemicals but if you require any sort of service steer very clear. It took them a year and a half to get us a pool cover. It took at least 4 fittings and them requiring more drilling of anchor points even though they took our old cover that fit perfectly to use as an example. They constantly blamed their vendor for their mistakes and lied to us to not take ownership of the problems. They will consistently not complete their pool opening and closing checklists. Totally unprofessional. I welcome any rebuttal from the management and I'll be happy to share the email chains.

resp.text: Mr. Houston, I was aware of some of the problems that existed but certainly not all of the ones you have listed. I apologize for all the inconveniences we caused you. It should not have happened. I will research it further. Thank you for your input and post such as this helps us to find our weaknesses.

name: Joshua Harris
text: Great customer service

name: Brittany Wray
text: Super friendly and knowledgeable sales staff! Free water testing and they tell you exactly what you need to put in, how much, and explains the reasoning behind it so you don’t feel like they’re just trying to make a sale!

name: Kimberly Greene
text:
My landlord recommended Johnson's to open our pool. They charged us $325 to open. Ok, no big deal. I get a call the day after they came out saying they couldn't "finish opening up the pool" because whoever closed the pool last sawed off the handrail and ladder. and estimated a bill of over $1000 of repairs. ok so I let the homeowner and agency deal with that. Both of whom were dragging their feet of course.
Turns out there were no repairs needed. I had another pool company come out to price and finish opening. All they had to do was stick the handrail in the holes. And my friend and I fixed the ladder ourselves. So $1000 worth of estimates repairs that aren't needed.
I called Johnson to see about a refund because all they did was take off the the cover, and after about three weeks the pool still looked bad. Kacy told me they completed the opening so I was still responsible for the entire bill. I asked then how come you told me y'all couldnt finish until the railings were fixed? Literally the only thing the workers did that first day was remove the cover and turn on the pump, and put in the first round of chemicals.
She seemed to get defensive about me trying to understand why i had to pay for an entire opening when they weren't coming out to finish the opening until who knows when. I should have only been charged for half, or they should have withheld the bill until it was finished. it's not like we could swim in it until then anyway.
Due to Kacys wording about the "cant FINISH until..." yet still charging full price, I would not use or recommend them to anyone.

name: Leah Bailey
text: Way to high in price! Shop around you will find great pool company’s for a lot cheaper.

name: GRASSLAND RANCH
text: Horrible customer service. Pool liner 3 weeks late. Day after day no one communicating with me. When I called and asked if we should leave the vacuum running that the tech hooked up to suction the liner they were rude. I mentioned the installer said the liner may be measured wrong because there were wrinkles. The owner Penny J said well you’re there what does it look like? I said ma’am I’m not the professional it’s not completely installed so I don’t know. She said “well you should be able to look at it .” This is just the beginning. I would not recommend them. They were friendly until they took my money and not a second after that.

resp.text: Unfortunately liners are conducive to weather and temperature and the installation is based on weather. If you experienced problems we are very sorry and it was not intentional. We apologize for your bad experience with our company.

name: Cynthia Patterson
text: Always very helpful.

name: Charles Chereek
text: Good place to get your pool and spa chemicals, accessories and hot tubs!!!

name: Aaron Brown
text: Friendly ,knoweble staff. They have been very helpful with my pool

resp.text: Thank you for spending time to write this review, We are so happy that we can provide you with the parts, service and products you need for your pool and spa. Thank you for your patronage and future business! We strive for customer service and professionalism and we are looking forward to serving you for MANY years to come.

name: Alura Young
text:
I was at Home Depot today getting some 2x4's for a shed that my husband and I are building. He was at home working on the shed so it was just me. Two gentleman volunteered to help when an employee said it may be a few minutes before someone would help me load it into my truck.
They put the wood in the bed, I said thank you and got in my truck to drive off.
I noticed they had a HUGE load of lumber to put into their own truck and noticed there was a business posted on their truck so I drove past to get the name.
Any business that has employees go out of their way to help random citizens are good with me!
Thank you again. I really appreciate it!

name: Jean Honyotski
text:
I ordered a liner from them and was told 4-6 weeks for delivery and install . It took over eight weeks for the installation.
The new liner installation was a disaster.
Listen up potential liner  buyers..... this could happen to you.

There was a sharp rock  left under liner by my stairs.
When the pool light  is turned on at night in the pool you can see at least 30 + lumps (many of them large) on the floor of my pool and the walls also.
I called to complain and am told Tommy, the owner “is working on it “. Then im told they would send the installer out.
They tell you what you want to hear, to get rid of you. I called asking to talk to Cassie, I’m told she’s not there, I call right back and surprise ..surprise she  IS actually there, they avoided my call.

I’ve got pages of texts saying he’s on his way, we are working on your problem.  He will be there Monday night, minutes later I’m on the phone with the installer who tells me he’s not coming
The installer tells me he will TRY to fit me into his schedule. What a joke !!!!!!

The installer  never came, when I talked to him personally he didn’t know anything about the lumps under my liner, didn’t know why he was supposed to be coming to my house. Needless to say he didn’t come
The whole process from start to finish was bad and they left the floor of my pool a disaster.
Save you money and go someplace else .

name: Wayne Ebenreiter (Mister E)
text: Great service, reasonable price.  Had a liner replaced in my inground pool.  The service department was freindy and knowledgeable.  The installation crew was clean a respectful of my property. On such a small job  I never expected Tommy the owner to come out. He not only came out but he walked me through the process and told me what to expect.  I would highly recommend Johnson's for any pool needs.  I am a customer for life.

name: Donald Kelley
text: Excellent help and water testing of pool and spa water

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review.  It is always a pleasure to serve our customers and providing them with the information and chemicals  they need to maintain their pools and spas.

name: Joe Stevens
text: Always a friendly experience.  And their advice is spot on for our pool.

name: Frank Fosdick
text: Called looking for a person to install a above ground pool. They would not help, because they said it was against company policy.  They are just talking money out of that person pocket.

resp.text: Good morning, Frank. Unfortunately we don’t have any installers, we are retail only for above ground pools. We were not trying to not help you, our sales person you spoke to was indeed following company protocol. If you have questions please call us at 256-533-3188 and have a blessed day!

name: Collis Sims
text: Good, professional service. Really the only helpful pool place in town.

name: H P
text: Just post your prices on the website. Had to sit on hold to talk to a salesmen who could only tell me they go from $5200 to $22000. No details and couldn’t even tell me why I would want their tub over a $3000 one.

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to post this review, I’m truly sorry that we weren’t able to fully explain the major differences between our exclusive Sundance Spa lineup and a spa that cost $3000. I would love to talk to you more about hot tubs and the benefits of owning one of ours.  I would agree with you on not posting or showing our prices, we ARE making changes to our showroom and looking to bring a better website experience to you.  If you are still interested in hot tubs, I would love to send you over some material that would show you everything that Sundance Spas has to offer. If that’s something you would consider, feel free to email me at Charles@johnsonpoolsandspas.com. I’m more than happy to assist you with all your hot tub needs and desires...Once again, I’m truly sorry that we couldn’t provide you with the information you were seeking but I hope in the future, we have the chance to show you what we are all about.

name: Theresa Weir
text: I like the store and people just prices are high

name: Brian Kessinger
text: Their sales staff is friendly, but the service manager is not so much. I would recommend going elsewhere for service.

resp.text: So sorry that you experienced the problems with our service department. We apologize for any inconvenience we might have caused. It is never intentional that we are unkind to any customer.

name: Devera Hester
text:
I can't give negative stars or I sure would. I have been waiting since I believe Nov for a mystery part for a hot tub that the service tech said he had at the shop. He left and never came back, I called a couple weeks later and was told by the service manager that it was my job to have placed a service call when the tech left my house that day...did not realize I was now an employee of Johnson Pools! I guess since I didn't place a call that day the part he had got shipped out somewhere else and they now had to order another for me. A couple weeks later I take it upon myself to call the tech directly (since I'm now an honorary employee of Johnson's) and he informs me he will be at my house after lunch and will call me when he's 30 minutes out...great. At the same time I'm on the phone with him, I'm getting a voice mail from the service manager telling me the part didn't come in and it will be a couple more weeks...wth??? How can he be coming out to my house with no part???? My gut tells me the part was needed for a more important job and mine was reordered again and this time is....wait for it, ON BACK ORDER!!!
My advice, there are other pool companies in this town

name: Deborah Stevens
text: Pool water testing,  very friendly knowledgeable staff

name: John MacDonald
text:
I asked for a pool opening and in return I got my pumps turned on (yes, a switch), a $7 pressure gage I didn't ask for, and a $195.00 dollar invoice. They charge for services not-rendered and then act bullish and naive. "We took off your pool cover" (I don't have a pool cover). They take exception when you call them out on their deceptive and incompetent practices acting indignant and offended. They assume that they are a good company because they've served the Northern Alabama area for "over 41 years." I interpret that as, "they've  gotten away with negligible service while over-charging for 41 years." I'm disgusted and do not recommend this company to anyone, for any reason. In business due to lack of competition. Criminals don't always wear masks, and this review isn’t an assault - although clearly insulting to the recipient - it’s my appraisal of their operation.

And if there is a reply to my review below from them, I assure you it's shallow and worthless.

name: Ellen Holden
text: They put in my in ground pool. They are so nice and helpful. My pool looks great.

name: Heather Whitmore
text: Great customer service, friendly staff, decent prices, love the free water testing!

name: Chipper2733
text: Almost 11 years ago we bought an above ground pool from Johnson.  We paid for it months before it was installed -- keep this fun fact in the back of your mind -- and seemed super easy and hassle free. Walked in the store, told the salesman we were looking for the largest above ground pool we could get that would be about 5 feet deep. He was super helpful, because we also admitted we knew nothing about the specifics, dimensions, or details; just what we wanted. We ordered and paid for a 27 foot round, 52 in walled, extended liner package.  We were also, originally,  getting a hot tub.  However 2 months after the purchase we found out we were having a baby, so we opted out of the hot tub, and stayed with just the pool.  3 months after that, pool installers brought the pool and did their thing.  My wife was concerned when they finished because the over lap liner was 6 inches from the ground in places, but they convinced  her that was what an overlap liner was supposed to look like. It took her about 3 weeks to actually get in the pool (when it was finally warm enough) and then she just cried. It was 3 and a half feet deep at its highest point. She drove her very large, pregnant self down to johnson pools and spoke with the original salesman.  He very shortly told her they have no affiliation with the installers, and there was nothing Johnson Pools could do to make it right, because it wasn't their fault.   Wife said her blood pressure got so high she thought she was going to have the baby at their store. Fast forward to the end of the first summer -- when we ordered a winter cover (obviously from a different place, the last time to step foot in the showroom she almost birthed a baby on their floor and swore them off for good)  we learned it was a 24' pool. 😲. Now, here we are, over a decade later, ready to replace the liner and find out THE WALLS ARE 48 inches tall. How much did we over pay for what we have?!! I'm still disgusted with the whole thing,  and have gotten in the pool MAYBE 5 times in 10 years.  My wife says every year we open the pool and the kids are taller she just gets angry all over again. We're 10 years late leaving this review, so our apologies if anyone else has had an equally horrible experience.

name: Darlene Carpenter
text:
Worst customer service ever from the service manager. We had a pool liner installed last year. Not even two weeks after install it sprung a leak. I called and  explained the situation, we had been left a warranty card but the serial number was not put on it. The Service rep said no worries she would take care of it ASAP get back to me on delivery... several days went by and no call. I contacted her again and stressed we were having a Birthday party and needed the pool up and running. She promised to get back to me. I called her two days later... She isn’t there has gone on a mission with her parents. So I start all over with someone else. He calls me back! It gets delivered early! Yeah we are going to have time to get it up and running and won’t have to have go with plan B for the birthday girl. The installers are great guys and get the new liner installed! Yeah!! They leave and we start filling! It now Saturday and we have lost two months of Pool time! We go get salt to get this thing going... Monday I call her back and let her know we are looking good and ask about the chemicals and the expense. I explained we had already gotten salt. No worries she says, bring in a sample we will get you what you need and give you credit. Ok that seems fair. I take a sample down, they give me algaecide and other chemicals, When I go to check out hey have to get her since I should be credited.  She has the cashier comp the stuff, I ask her what about the salt I have already purchased? She says she will give us store credit for the qty we bought. Ok that works for me!  Fast forward to last week. I go to the shop and get algaecide and shock to get the pool up and running for the year. I explained I should have a credit and the tech finds my account so he goes to talk to her... a few minutes later they come back. She bellows at me “You don’t have any credit with us! The last thing on your account was the $95.00 credit for the chemicals we gave you to get your pool up and running.”
I reminded her of the conversation we had. “You are wrong!” She says, you should have requested the salt the then” “I said had I known I would have.
I turned to the tech and said Thank you I will not be purchasing these items today.” I never raised my voice or was rude or condescending.
She continued to berate me as I started to leave the store. She says “you haven’t bought anything from us in  a year!” I said we haven’t needed anything... She goes on and says “You have to be buying something!”
At that point I said well it certainly won’t be here again, have a wonderful rest of the day 😊” and left the store.

Now mind you every other person I talked to at Johnson’s has been really nice! I will not be recommending them to anyone. They are not true to their word and are rude for no reason.

name: Jeff McKinney
text: A great place to shop for Big Green Egg supplies. The only negative is that they do not accept Am Ex. Otherwise a great locally owned place to do business for grilling accessories, pool supplies and outdoor furniture.

name: jill cattaneo
text:
AFTER 12 YEARS OF ALMOST DAILY USE OUR ALTIMAR SPA FROM JOHNSON POOLS NEEDED TO BE REPLACE, I CHECKED SEVERAL OTHER DEALERS AND THEIR "SPECIALS" AND  DECIDED TO  RETURN TO   JOHNSON POOLS AND SPA IN HUNTSVILLE AL , AND PLESANTLY SAW GREG THE STORE MANAGER WHO HAD SOLD ME  OUR 1ST SPA THERE, HE WENT OVER EACH OF THE SPAS AND INVITED ME TO TRY OUT ONE IN PRIVATE IF I SO DESIRED, I KNEW PRETTY MUCH WHAT WE WERE LOOKING FOR,  THE SPAS HERE HAVE THE BEST WARRANTY I HAD SEEN AFTER SHOPPING AROUND AND THE SPAS ON THE FLOOR WERE PRICED TO MOTIVATE ME TO MAKE "THE DEAL" WE LOVE! LOVE ! LOVE ! OUR CHOICE.. WE CHANGED MODELS AND WENT WITH THE LOUNGE CHAIRS AND FOOT MESSAGE AND WATERFALL   AWESOME!  WILL BE BACK IN TEN FOR THE NEXT ONE! I ADVISE TO CHECK OUT THIS PLACE AND TALK TO GREG BEFORE YOU MAKE YOUR PURCHASE ANY WHERE ELSE , THESE SPAS MAYBE A BIT HIGHER IN PRICE, BUT BELIEVE ME, YOU DO GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!
THE CATTANEO FAMILY

name: Daniel Burton
text: When I walked in, there was no one around. When one appeared, they were unable to answer my question and the second person was not very polite

resp.text: Not sure what your question might have been and we are very sorry for your bad experience. We make every attempt to treat every customer with kindness and respect. Please feel free to call my cell at 256/990-9416  and I will be more than happy to discuss this further. Penny Johnson

name: Marcus Atchison
text: Very friendly, informative, and helpful staff

name: T. Barnes
text: Friendly staff and a good repair shop.

name: Joe Fischetti
text: Wonderful people who are always ready to help.

name: Clarence Ragland
text:
On August 27, I visited Johnson Pools and Spas to order a panle for my Hawthorne 680 to replace damage done on moving to Huntsville. Johnson Pools and Sap ordered the replcaement, and told me they would notify me when the panel arrived, usually in about two weeks.

Well, two weeks pass, then three, not notification, no panel. So I called them, and was told the panel had arrived and they were going to call me when I called them (a likely story). They made an appointment to deliver and install the panel, and lo and behold, the panel is the wrong color!

It was September by then, the workers too a portion of the damaged panel back to the store to ensure the right color was ordered, and I haven't heard a thing since, and it's November 11th as I write this. I plan to contact Johnson Pools and Saps and let them know in no uncertain terms that I am totally dissatisfied with they way they have conducted business in the case; which is basically no response to the customer at all!

name: Vanessa Kacer
text: Wow—having trouble with my above ground pool and looking for someone in the area to help. When I called, they refused to even give me the NAME of someone who could help me since I didn’t buy the pool from them. Complete unnecessary. I know where I will NOT be returning for my future pool needs.

resp.text: Very sorry you had this experience with Johnson Pools & Spas. Unfortunately we do not recommend other installers. That is a policy we implemented several years ago because people can get a bad experience and hold us accountable for the actions of our recommendation. We apologize for the inconvenience.

text: Good place for pool supplies and pool construction..

name: Frances Akins
text: We have had good experience in previous years but they failed me this year. After spending over $800 for them to open the pool it is still not usable. They say it might be bad valves but they don't do that. I am very disappointed that they can't help get the pool in good shape.

name: Kristie S
text: Great people and very helpful

name: zachary ormstedt
text: Very friendly staff, very helpful

name: David P
text: Good guys

name: john strihafka
text: Very knowledgeable and friendly

name: Jeffrey Hudson
text: If Johnson Pools & Spa does not have it, your pool doesn't need it.

name: D Ortiz
text: Less than zero was not available. Terrible customer service, they would not even come out to do an estimate. I was told we will call you back but the call never happened. I called them back and was told RUDELY,  we are too busy.

resp.text: Thank you for taking your valuable time to leave this review, I’m sorry to hear about your terrible customer service you received from our company. We strive for complete satisfaction and great customer service, This behavior is unacceptable and we should have been more professional about this situation.  If you choose to use us in the future, which I hope you do, just know this type of behavior would not happen again.
